channel.title: How do i include .scar files?
channel.description:
I still need some major help. To setup, you guys say that i need to do file/download includes, i only see .txt files... Yet most of the autocutters and autominers say you need to include .scar files. I went to program files/scar 2.0.3. and there is includes folder which holds all the .txt files that i saw previously, and the .scar files...
How do i include the .scar files? :confused: :confused: :confused:

item.title: How do i include .scar files?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Yes, you can only get SRL with Divi or at SRL-Forums.com, but use of the {.include …} can include both text(.txt) and SCAR(.scar) files, nothing else.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i include .scar files?
item.dc:creator: @timothyx timothyx
item.description:
@timothyx wrote:

hmm yes exp has a point, fil>download SRL (if the srl is in the includes folder) should work

try it stupid

Read full topic

item.title: How do i include .scar files?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

If you are using divi, go to file>download SRL

else ‘get the latest version of SRL (found here).’

Read full topic

item.title: How do i include .scar files?
item.dc:creator: @ceacea25 ceacea25
item.description:
@ceacea25 wrote:

No no no… im using other people script, and at the top of the page, it says-
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}
{.include SRL\SRL\skill\WoodCutting.scar}

When i go to file/download includes, they arent on the list.

There are some other cutters that say-
{.include Osi.txt}
{.include par.txt}

Those are on this list.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i include .scar files?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I’m confused on whats going on here.

If you are trying to run somebody’s pre-made script, then they already have SRL set up. All you need to do is make sure you have the newest version of SRL (found here).

If you are making a script, you need to {.include SRL\SRL.scar} after the program name, then tell SCAR to ‘SetUpSRL;’ at the beginning of your main loop.

Read full topic
